intro: Polypodium dareiformioides, commonly known as the Indian cliff fern, is a species of fern native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen, leathery fronds that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant typically grows on rocky surfaces or in shaded, humid environments, showcasing its adaptability to challenging conditions. Its spores are dispersed through the wind, contributing to its reproductive strategy in its natural habitat. The botanical features of this fern make it an interesting subject for both ecological and horticultural study.
